intro: Sinodielsia delavayi, commonly known as the Yunnan poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the opium poppy. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
